explains: n. 乌托邦，理想中最完美的社会

sentences.en: We weren't out to design a contemporary utopia.
sentences.cn: 我们不想去设计一个当代乌托邦。

sentences.en: I know not what the younger dreams—some vague Utopia—and she seems, when withered old and skeleton-gaunt, an image of such politics.
sentences.cn: 我不知道年轻一代的梦想是什么——某种模糊的乌托邦——而当她憔悴衰老、骨瘦如柴时，她似乎就是这种政治的化身。

sentences.en: Now utopia has grown unfashionable, as we have gained a deeper appreciation of the range of threats facing us, from asteroid strike to epidemic flu and to climate change.
sentences.cn: 现如今，这种乌托邦空想已经过时了，我们对所面临的威胁有了更深刻的认识，从彗星撞击到流行感冒，再到气候变化。
